ost_step.3: Days in a year = 365 (leap years are ignored)
ost_step.4: Days already passed = 365 - 10 - 31 - 30 - 31 (December 31st was on a Wednesday this year) = 317

This is called his calorie deficit, which is calculated as follows: daily calorie intake - daily calorie expenditure = daily calorie deficit. Therefore, Andy's calorie deficit is: (calories required for maintenance - calories burned through exercise) - daily calorie intake = 3500 - calories burned through exercise - daily calorie intake. To calculate calories burned through exercise, we use the formula: calories burned = basal metabolic rate (BMR) x activity level x time spent exercising per day.
